column5: What do you mean by all inclusive? Hidden Bay Lodge has a good package, they put you up the night before your flight, the have a meal program too.
I can't help you with all-inclusives but if you narrow down what species you want to fish for, time of year and what part of Canada you're interested in others may be able to help.
With the Guys I know... "ALL INCLUSIVE" would BANKRUPT 95% of the Lodges and resorts..

A few you can check out. They are American Plan. I don't think any include alcoholic beverages. http://www.centurylodge.com/index.htmlhttp://exc-adventures.com/cat-island-lodge/http://www.kabeelo.com/http://www.rowdylake.com/http://www.bignorthlodge.com/lodge/http://www.halleyscamps.com/kettle-falls-lodge/http://www.halleyscamps.com/one-man-lake-lodge/http://www.alexandersonrowanlake.com/http://andersonslodge.com/http://www.minnitakilake.ca/index.phphttp://www.oaklakelodge.com/
Eagle Lake Island Lodge has a per day rate that includes OPEN BAR.
Oh, I just meant the ones I listed I know there are some places that offer alcoholic drinks, and for sure know some have an open bar during dinner or happy hour.
